Questionnairehttps://kind-lab.github.io/vbai-fhir/Questionnaire-dvoicelaryngealcancerschema#2.2.0
diagnois_lc_gsd_sll1. Gold Standard Diagnosis: Did the patient get a laryngoscopy/stroboscopy confirming the presence of a suspicious laryngeal lesion?0..1choiceOptions: 3 options
diagnosis_lc_gsd_bprDoes the patient have laryngeal cancer confirmed by biopsy/pathology report?0..1choiceOptions: 3 options
diagnosis_lc_gsd_uotsDid the patient undergo other types of scans? (Select all that apply).0..1string
diagnosis_lc_ds2. Disease Subtype: Which laryngeal structures are/were involved? (Select all that apply).0..1string
diagnosis_lc_etiology3. Etiology: Check any risk factors of this patient in relation to their laryngeal cancer. (Select all that apply).0..1string
diagnosis_lc_etiology_otherPlease specify:0..1stringEnable When: diagnosis_lc_etiology = '1'
diagnosis_lc_ds_t_stage4. Disease Severity: What is the T stage of the cancer based on the AJCC Classification?0..1choiceOptions: 8 options
diagnosis_lc_ds_t_refPlease see the table for reference:0..1string
diagnosis_lc_ds_n_stageWhat is the N stage of the cancer based on the AJCC Classification?0..1choiceOptions: 7 options
diagnosis_lc_ds_n_refPlease see Table for reference:0..1string
diagnosis_lc_ds_m_stageWhat is the M stage of the cancer based on the AJCC Classification?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_degree_textWhat is the degree of dysphonia? Clinician places slider between 0 and 100; indicates C or I. "Indicate the nature.." and Additional features responses are free text. Comments about resonance: Indicate normal or Other, if other then free text0..1string
diagnosis_lc_degree_legendLegend: C- Sonsistent I = IntermittentMI = Mildly DeviantMO = Moderately DeviantSE = Severely Deviant0..1string
diagnosis_lc_degree_os_1Overall Severity0..1string
diagnosis_lc_degree_os_2Overall Severity0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_degree_r_1Roughness0..1string
diagnosis_lc_degree_r_2Roughness0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_degree_b_1Breathiness0..1string
diagnosis_lc_degree_b_2Breathiness0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_degree_s_1Strain0..1string
diagnosis_lc_degree_s_2Strain0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_degree_p_1Pitch0..1string
diagnosis_lc_degree_p_naturePitch (Indicate the nature of the abnormality):0..1stringEnable When: diagnosis_lc_degree_p_1 > 0
diagnosis_lc_degree_p_2Pitch0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_degree_l_1Loudness0..1string
diagnosis_lc_degree_l_natureLoudness (Indicate the nature of the abnormality):0..1stringEnable When: diagnosis_lc_degree_l_1 > 0
diagnosis_lc_degree_l_2Loudness0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_degree_commentsComments about resonance0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_degree_comments_otherPlease specify0..1stringEnable When: diagnosis_lc_degree_comments = 'other'
diagnosis_lc_degree_comments_other_2Additional Features (for example, diplophonia, fry, falsetto, asthenia, aphonia, pitch instability, tremor, wet/gurgly, or other relevant terms):0..1string
diagnosis_as_ds_ccsrIs the cancer causing stridor at rest?0..1choiceOptions: 4 options
diagnosis_lc_treatment5. Treatment obtained: Has the patient undergone any treatment for their condition?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
diagnosis_lc_treatment_selectSelect all that apply:0..1stringEnable When: diagnosis_lc_treatment = 'yes'
diagnosis_lc_treatment_sSurgery0..1stringEnable When: diagnosis_lc_treatment_select = '1'
diagnosis_lc_treatment_otherOther, please specify0..1stringEnable When: diagnosis_lc_treatment_select = '1'

Documentation for this format

Options Sets

Answer options for diagnois_lc_gsd_sll

  • Yes
  • No
  • Not certain

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_gsd_bpr

  • Yes
  • No
  • Not certain

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_ds_t_stage

  • Tis (carcinoma in situ)
  • T1a
  • T1b
  • T2
  • T3
  • T4a
  • T4b
  • Unknown yet

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_ds_n_stage

  • N0
  • N1
  • N2a
  • N2b
  • N2c
  • N3
  • Unknown yet

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_ds_m_stage

  • M0: no distant metastasis
  • M1: Any distant metastasis

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_degree_os_2

  • Consistent
  • Intermittent

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_degree_r_2

  • Consistent
  • Intermittent

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_degree_b_2

  • Consistent
  • Intermittent

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_degree_s_2

  • Consistent
  • Intermittent

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_degree_p_2

  • Consistent
  • Intermittent

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_degree_l_2

  • Consistent
  • Intermittent

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_degree_comments

  • Normal
  • Other

Answer options for diagnosis_as_ds_ccsr

  • No the patient does not have stridor
  • Yes mild stridor
  • Yes moderate stridor
  • Yes severe stridor

Answer options for diagnosis_lc_treatment

  • Yes
  • No

item.text: 1. Gold Standard Diagnosis: Did the patient get a laryngoscopy/stroboscopy confirming the presence of a suspicious laryngeal lesion?
Does the patient have laryngeal cancer confirmed by biopsy/pathology report?

Did the patient undergo other types of scans?
(Select all that apply).

2. Disease Subtype: Which laryngeal structures are/were involved?
(Select all that apply).

3. Etiology: Check any risk factors of this patient in relation to their laryngeal cancer.
(Select all that apply).
4. Disease Severity: What is the T stage of the cancer based on the AJCC Classification?
Please see the table for reference:
What is the N stage of the cancer based on the AJCC Classification?
What is the M stage of the cancer based on the AJCC Classification?

What is the degree of dysphonia?

Clinician places slider between 0 and 100; indicates C or I. "Indicate the nature.." and Additional
features responses are free text. Comments about resonance: Indicate normal or Other, if other then free text
Legend: C- Sonsistent I = IntermittentMI = Mildly DeviantMO = Moderately DeviantSE = Severely Deviant

Pitch
(Indicate the nature of the abnormality):

Loudness
(Indicate the nature of the abnormality):

Additional Features
(for example, diplophonia, fry, falsetto, asthenia, aphonia, pitch instability, tremor, wet/gurgly, or other relevant terms):
Is the cancer causing stridor at rest?

answerOption.valueString: No the patient does not have stridor

item.text: 5. Treatment obtained: Has the patient undergone any treatment for their condition?
